intro: Seseli gummiferum subsp. corymbosum, commonly known as the clustered globemallow, is a flowering plant in the family Papaveraceae. It is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit and produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is native to regions of the western United States. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy texture. The subspecies is distinguished by its more compact inflorescence compared to other subspecies of Seseli gummiferum.
